DataElement.preferredName: FACT-G Questionnaire Version 4 GP5 How True Past Seven Days Bothered By Side Effects of Treatment Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how true in the past 7 days they are bothered by side effects of treatment, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACT-G Questionnaire Seven Past Day Bothered By Side Effects of Treatment How True Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G._A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one._Before the present time._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day._A question about whether an individual is or has been bothered by the side effects of their treatment._A question about an individual's agreement with a statement._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.

Concepts.definition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.

Property.preferredName: Seven Past Day Bothered By Side Effects How True Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.:Before the present time.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.:A survey question about whether a person is bothered by side effects of their treatment.:A survey question about a personÂ¿s agreement with a statement.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 6 and less than 8 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of six and one.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

Concepts.longName: Bothered By Side Effects of Treatment
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual is or has been bothered by the side effects of their treatment.
A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DECs released per approval of model owner. mc 10/26/10 Updated concept definition C91781 to remove special characters for MDR data migration. 3.5.20 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on FACT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring and Interpretation Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.
